meanings.definition: To eject or expel (something) from the mouth
meanings.sent1: The baby disgorged the milk after feeding.
meanings.sent2: The cat disgorged a hairball on the carpet.
meanings.sent3: The clown disgorged a stream of confetti from his mouth.
meanings.sent4: The volcano disgorged a river of lava, destroying everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The overflowing sink disgorged water all over the kitchen floor.

meanings.sent1: The pressure build-up caused the pipe to disgorged water everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The factory disgorged smoke into the sky.
meanings.sent3: The magician disgorged a flurry of colorful scarves from his sleeve.
meanings.sent4: The storm disgorged rain in torrents, flooding the streets.
meanings.sent5: The machine disgorged coins with a loud clatter.

meanings.definition: To pour out or empty (something) from a container
meanings.sent1: She disgorged the contents of the bucket into the garden.
meanings.sent2: The truck disgorged a load of gravel onto the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The chef disgorged a delicious stew from the pot.
meanings.sent4: The dam disgorged water downstream, causing a flood.
meanings.sent5: The backpack disgorged a jumble of books and papers when it fell.
